a literal stressful scenario although that's part of it it's to say well what happens what happens to our design
decision or a technology choice what happens to this feature if we put it
under stress we put it under the pressure of somebody who's not necessarily our ideal customer or isn't
necessarily having a normal use case what happens if that person's use case is a little bit
and of what we typically think of when we're designing this product does it still work or not are we failing them
and what we found is that oftentimes it was actually really easy if you started thinking about stress cases it was very
easy to recognize little things that could be big problems for people and to make tweaks that would actually make it
work better for everybody the idea being that if you can make something work for people who have maybe a little bit of a
special circumstance then you can oftentimes make it work better for everybody who has the normal use case as
